```{r include=FALSE}
library(pgxRpi)
```

```{r include=FALSE}
freq <- pgxLoader(type='frequency', output='pgxseg',filters='NCIT:C3058',
                  codematches=T)
```

## Visualize data

### By genome

```{r}
pgxFreqplot(freq)

```


### By chromosome

```{r echo=FALSE, fig.height=6}
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 7)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 9)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 10)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 13)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 19)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 20)
pgxFreqplot(freq,chrom = 22)
```

## Step5: Analyse the data

According the plot, we can see frequenct gains on chromosome 7p, 7q, 19p, (19q,) 20p, 20q 
and frequenct losses on chromosome 9p,10p, 10q, 13q, 22q.
